page.title: 06SCOTRAIL WORKSHOPS
page.content: These workshops have been in existence since 1870 approx, and were probably built in Irvine because the town was the only one in the area which had a lot of engineering concerns. Irvine depot provides a base for two departments -(1) Civil Engineering, (2) Signal and Telegraph Engineering. The latter department is very important because it is the only Signal and Telegraph equipment workshop in Scotland. They make signal posts, signal control boxes, metal boxes, cabinets and cupboards, and repair telephone equipment. At one time many people served four year apprenticeships in the workshops but today there are none.Economies and efficiency measures have meant a reduction in numbers of employees (1975 - 70 workers, 1985 - 24 workers.)
